comment: I can honestly say that Professor Hyon was one of the best English professors I've ever had. Truth be told, I've never been one to read outside of class or participate in lectures, but she really made me care about the material. If you need to fulfill a Lit credit, I can't recommend her highly enough.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took her Maymester class. Didn't like her at first, but turned out to not be so bad. I tried hard and got an A. Be prepared to spend several hours each night reading through dull material. She's a tough grader, but drops lowest quizzes/journals, and grades all written work with an understanding that it's just a rough draft. She's moving to Denver.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Her lectures were reviews of papers her previous students had submitted, done by the class as a unit. For the bulk of the semester. Did not understand the material being taught enough to answer the students' questions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I currently have her for ENGL 2112 and I absolutely love her! Everything she assigns is very clear. There are a few weekly discussion boards you have to do, and there are 4 tests and 2 papers, all of which are easy A's if you study hard enough. She's super nice and honestly is one of the best English profs I've had at KSU!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved Katherine Hyon. She's one of those teachers that will make you work hard but she will work with you. Always giving encouraging words. I wish she was my teacher for the rest of my career!. A real teacher.

Almost every class is spent picking apart the same handful of sample papers, then reviewing the D2L document for the next assignment. Gives out pop quizzes on reading. Lots of essay writing, tough grader.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Really feel like I found the diamond in the rough with getting professor Owens as my teacher. I usually hear about how tough and hard English classes and English professors could be, but he's totally the opposite. Easy-going, laid-back, and he's always happy when you come to him with a question or stay after class. Definitely the guy to take!!

Was actually such an amazing professor.  Her lectures were all so involved and she always leaves the floor open for you to make comments and you'll feel so comfortable giving them.  She can be a really tough grader, but she actually teaches you in a fun way how to write good papers. Also, NO TESTS! Would take again for sure.

For not being in school for 6 years and getting back into the groove she was clear on her objectives but when it came to papers she was extremely tough at grading. She gives you one opportunity to revise a paper but with the work load between classes is almost seemed impossible. Most essays turned out to be C's.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Would never take one of her classes again. She grades papers extremely hard, everyone gets a C and then you get to do a revision on the paper. If she doe not agree with what you are saying in your essay you will get points marked off. Basically you have to write papers to please her opinions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Overall  she is a good professor, but she grades very harshly. I have never in my life gotten a C on a paper but in her class i did. She does allow you to do revisions on your paper but just because you do revisions doesn't mean your grade will go up. You have 3 papers before you final one so it isn't too bad.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Overall pretty good professor but the class material is very boring. Long assigned readings with graded discussion board posts  I fell asleep while reading a lot. Tests are fairly challenging. Attendance is required but all you do is sit in class and discuss the reading. Just take a more interesting lit class like Modern or American.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: shes absolutely the hardest grader ever. so intimidating and rude. she puts you on spot and her essays are so hard. DO NOT RECOMMEND HER AT ALL.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER FOR 1101! Grades essays WAY too harshly and does not really help when it comes to revisions! This class is not a easy A, or even a B. Try to avoid taking her class. She gives out pop quizzes so make sure you read and complete assignments, and you will need both books.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She doesn't give tests, but you do write 3 papers based on essay types listed in the book. She prepares you well for the essays with ideas due one class, draft due next, and group feedbacks after until your final is due. She has you read articles and answer questions about them and ones she doesn't ask for responses from are most likely a quiz.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Lets you choose the topic of term paper. You have to write a proposal and three short papers that all contribute to the final paper. Although it seems like a lot, she allows you to meet with her and revise each paper once to take a shot at a better grade. I worked hard for my A, but it wasn't impossible. If you try hard, she notices and will help

Do the discussion boards as they help tremendously for the test topics. I did not take the class seriously at first and catch up was impossible. The course builds upon itself and you have to apply broad concepts to everything you read throughout the semester. I found the tests confusing and pointless know dates, authors, places, basically memorize!

Very straightforward with what is expected in her class. She is a tough grader and provides great feedback. You can't miss many days in her class and she expects you to participate. Overall she was a good teacher and I would recommend her.

GREAT professor! Makes reading material very simple by going over and discussing during class. But be warned, there's A LOT to read. Provides studyguides on D2L, exams are easy and worded exactly how she goes over the text in class. Assigns Discussion Board Qs which asks for analysis of the text weekly. Simple and an easy grade booster!
A lot of reading and work. She really helps with essay writing and will give feedback if needed. If you keep up with the work and participate in class you should have no problems but keep up!

I took her maymester class and it was rather easy, you have to read everynight but it is worth it in terms of not having to read during a normal semester. Drops 1-3 of the lowest quizes and the lowest journal entry.

If you don't do as well as you'd like on the first test and essay, you are stressed the rest of the semester about the last ones. By then, you know her testing style, so usually you do better. Classes are interesting and dynamic. Aside from the fact that there are only two tests and two in-class essays in this class, it was a good class.

Tough grader, she tore my papers apart. I even met with her during office hours to revise all of my papers, showed up to every class, participated in discussions and always asked questions but when I finished with an 88 or 89, she wouldn't even round up. She never posts grades until the end of the semester, avoid her at all costs.

Horrible English teacher! She takes forever to grade reading responses, is not leanient on anything, you have to attend class, can't miss more than 3 days otherwise one letter grade is dropped, her tests are super hard even though there's only one midterm and a final. Don't take this teacher!!!!

She is such an awesome professor! She is a tough grader but she gives you a chance to revise every paper except the final one for a better grade. A lot of reading here and there, but it is all for class discussion and as long as you participate, there won't  a quiz over it. She will help you as long as you put in the effort. Take her!

dr. hyon really cares about improving your writing. tough grader but if you actually try it's impossible to fail. she knows her stuff but isn't pompous about it. classes are discussions where she just kind of helps guide students on to the right track, we talk more than her. participate in class and put thought into writing and you'll do fine.

Hyon mandates a paper written every week graded on a 10/10 system to make sure that you're doing your readings. Everything is posted on D2L and there's never any surprises. Her exams are complicated but nothing you can't handle if you study.

DO NOT TAKE HER FOR A MAYMESTER. This class is not meant to get an easy A in, and if you aren't particularly good or interested in English/Literature you're going to have to work to get a B. She's a good teacher, takes forever to give assignments/grades back. Very difficult concept to grasp if you don't like reading into things.

She doesn't realize it's world literature. 2 page paper due EVERY week, 3 extremely and unnecessarily hard/long tests, then a 6 page final paper. You HAVE to attend class to sit there and listen to fellow classmates, not the professor, talk/go over the books you just read. Got a 78-79 in the class, didn't bump me up. Avoid this class.

I loved this class. It explores literature outside of British and American works, and Professor Hyon is both clear and engaging. This class is heavily writing-oriented, but the professor offers detailed advice and assistance. The in-class discussions were enjoyable.

She's good teacher. Her class is challenging, but shes clear on what she wants and how to do work. She doesn't give As easy but you have the chance to revise your essays and get feedback from her. I wouldn't choose to take her class again but I wouldn't be upset if I have to.
Really enjoyed this class. We got to choose our own topics and she was really helpful when you ask for advice. She does grade harshly, but follow her advice and she will help you out.

Professor Hyon is a good professor and a nice person. Getting As aren't easy, but you can revise and up your grade on most papers. We basically worked on a single paper the whole semester. Don't buy the grammar book; it's a waste. Attendance is mandatory.

Dr. Hyon is extremely helpful. She gives a few little homework assignments but the majority of the semester you pick one topic and you write several little papers and build up to a ten page paper as a final on that same topic. It sounds hard but the class is easy. You get 3 days to miss and then you lose points. you wont regret taking her.

This professor means business - make your arguments crystal clear and you'll go far. While she doesn't hand out A's (by any means..) she allows revisions on most of the papers during the first half of the semester. Be prepared to be challenged because you might actually learn something!

Sets up her classroom rules first few days of class and then quizzed. 4 papers due plenty of opportunities to revise during workshop groups. A group project due almost same time as final paper. She is very nice just have to attend class, ask questions during class, answer her when asked a question, engage or you will be taking a lot of quizzes.
Dr. Hyon is a funny, friendly teacher. She rarely gives A's, but if you're a good writer there's no reason you can't ace  her class.  I did :)

I made an A in the class but through a lot of hard work. We had a paper due every week, and it keeps you really busy. If you are an English major like me it is totally helpful. She appears intimidating and cold at first, but she is kind. No easy A's though. Difficult but helpful professor.

This woman is an Asian goddess.  I really wish I had the courage to ask her out.  She is smart, beautiful and a great teacher.  I loved her class and was sad when it was over.  She does not just hand out and "A" but if you earn it, then you have bettered yourself as a writer.

She is an amazing professor! I took her for 1101 & 1102. She grades harshly but lets you revise almost all of your papers. She's very helpful. I enjoyed her class. Attendance is important. She doesn't give out As you have to work for it. Overall I highly recommend her. You will improve as a writer.

This professor is amazing!!! I strongly recommend her! She made it fun and interested and is beyond helpful! Not only is she super nice but she is even funny at times!I have always hated english but she honesly made me love it! Take her if at all possible!!!!

These professor is tough on grading papers but lets you revise them after you have turned them in. She gives you the chance to meet up with her personally and she tells you what you need to do to get at least a B on every paper. She really does help you become a better writer. Overall she's a great professor!! Take her! plus she's hot lol

Prof. Hyun is a no nonsense woman. her tests are straight forward but you have to support your arguments. she is very specific in what she wants and sort of vague in how she tells you what she wants....not a good combo. bottom line, not the end of the world if you have to take her but I would go with the lecture class over her

If you want to be challenged as a writer, then take her class. I wasn't such a fan of Prof. Hyon, but that was because I felt that she was very intimidating and sometimes cold. I was never comfortable talking to her. BUT she is a very smart woman and will grade very harshly.

I honestly love this class and am going to miss it dearly. Professor Hyon is such an interesting woman with a great sense of humor. I loved the class and as a result, I did not skip any classes. Her grading is a little strict so come to class and try on every paper. Other than that participate in discussions and you will have fun.

Professor Hyon does not give out As. If you want a good grade you have to work for it. Her exams, as any other class in the English department consists of short answers and brief essays. Reading responses are required and too many absences will knock your grade down one letter. Come to class, take notes and participate. As are achievable.

She's a really great teacher, and really knows her stuff. The class discussions are not only fun, but you learn stuff too. The flipside to that is, she REALLY knows her stuff, so as a result her grading can be a bit tough at times. However, she's willing to help inside and outside of class. I couldn't recommend her class any higher.

Ms. Hyon is a very helpful teacher. She leaves useful advise for your papers, which you are allowed to revise. If you know how to write this class is very easy, but if you are not so good she will help you grow. Class discussions are interesting, as are the assigned readings. I recommend this class.

Do NOT take her for English 2110. Her tests are ONLY essay questions and short answers. If you aren't good at in class essays don't take her. She also requires reading responses. She grades VERY strictly. I had to drop the class and I tried really hard in the class yet I was still falling behind.

She is a good teacher, but you have to work pretty hard for the grade. I did not buy the book and we only used it once. Four papers that are easy if you follow requirements. A LOT OF HOMEWORK. Readings and responses due nearly every class. You cannot miss class if you want to pass.

Great teacher. If you don't have a writing background there is a learning curve but she'll work with you until you get it. 3 papers that you get to revise, reflection paper and one group marketing analysis. Good course. Highly recommend. There are easier english professors but here you can learn and enjoy class.
Very helpful with essays. She does make you read a lot in the Movites book, and if you dont read, youll be lost. Fun class, and her discussions are interesting. Only 3 papers, and a portfolio.
She provides good feedback on returned essays, helping you better your future essay assignments.
Mrs. Hyon is awesome.  She is also really hot!  Take her class and be ready for a good time and a lot of discussions in class.
Mrs. Hyon was great.  And she is really hot.

Very good professor. She will provide useful feedback and she lets you revise all of your papers except for one. Does not hand out A's unless she feels like you put your really best work on your essays.
She seems really tought at first, but the workload is not terribly hard yet you still learn a lot during the course. It is a great English class to take fresh out of high school.

Pretty hard. When she corrects your papers, she will always always always find something terribly wrong with it, even on the sections you worked on improving. Class always seemed pointless and so so boring. Most people thought she was nice, but her personality came off as rude and arrogant.

She is very nice but at first she seems scary. Her syllabus may make you nervous but once the class gets started you learn how helpful she is. You can revise EVERY paper except the self review paper. All you have to do to revise your paper is to have a meeting with her so she can tell you what needs to be changed. Do not drop she is GREAT!!

Great professor. She's really easy. Doens't give many A's but it is extremely hard to get an F. She does alot of discuission that get frustrating but are intreresting. She lets you revise every paper you want. VERY GOOD!

She's a hard grader, most time, you will not get an A on a paper, however, if you make a bad grade, she gives you a chance to rewrite it after you meet with. When you meet with her, she helps tell you what's wrong and she'll explain her comments. She's not the worst teacher, she's acts nice, but the stricly business nice.

Essays are required. Revisions are accepted. Group Project is mandatory. she makes you do Workshops. Alot of discussion. Helps you out. RECOMMEND U TAKE HER IF U LIKE LITTLE TO NO WORK. you do have to read alot of articles.

She is a hard grader but she tells you what you did wrong on the papers. She is very nice, but she likes to have lots and lots of discussion. If not many people participate in discussions she does threaten to make you write about it. all i know is that I am taking her class for ENGL 1102

Extremely hard grader! Near impossible to get an A on anything. A Lot of reading essays and plenty of papers to write. She does allow revision of your papers once after she grades it. Dont expect a letter grade change on it though.(B- to B+) If you had an A in highschool english expect a B-/C+ in her class. No number grades. DO NOT TAKE HER!
Instructor is great!  She will definitely make you a better writer.  Was a little hard to understand what she wanted in the beginning, but by the end my grades improved.
Really good teacher. Just show up to class and write the papers and you will do fine. She even lets you revise the final draft to get a better grade. I def. recommend her.

DO NOT take this professor for your own sake and sanity. She gives out countless papers. We had to write about the SAME topic ALL semester.I was constantly doing papers for her class and NEVER had any free time during the week. She is an EXTREMELY hard grader and will make you feel like a horrible writer. Good luck you'll need it.
Nice and more helpful outside of the classroom. Hard paper grader, you'll have to redo it a billion times for a decent grade, but she'll teach you how to write.
No Comments
